Here's how.</div></div></div></section><main data-layer-region="article-body" class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-xxl"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-col-1 mdc-u-grid-col-md-12"><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-md-start-2 mdc-u-grid-col-md-end-12 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-start-3 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-end-11"><div class="mdc-o-content-body mck-u-dropcap"><div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="DownloadsSidebar_mck-c-downloads-sidebar__iFmyt mck-o-xs-right-span"><div data-layer-region="downloads-right-rail"><h3 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c mdc-c-heading--title___5qyOB_990311c mdc-c-heading--border___K8dj3_990311c">DOWNLOADS</h3><div><div data-component="mdc-c-link-container" class="mdc-c-link-container___xefGu_990311c"><a data-component="mdc-c-link" href="#/download/%2F~%2Fmedia%2Fmckinsey%2Findustries%2Foil%20and%20gas%2Four%20insights%2Flng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test%2Flng-portfolio-optimization-putting-the-business-model-to-the-test.pdf%3FshouldIndex%3Dfalse" class="DownloadsSidebar_mck-c-downloads-sidebar__download-link__fPqFQ mdc-c-link___lBbY1_990311c" target="_self" data-layer-event-prefix="Download Link" data-layer-action="click" data-layer-report-type="Article" data-layer-file-name="lng-portfolio-optimization-putting-the-business-model-to-the-test" data-layer-report-name="lng-portfolio-optimization-putting-the-business-model-to-the-test>Article"><span data-component="mdc-c-icon" class="mdc-c-icon___oi7ef_990311c mdc-c-icon--size-md___yi5fA_990311c mck-download-icon"></span><span class="mdc-c-link__label___Pfqtd_990311c">Article (9 pages)</span></a></div></div></div></div>
<p><strong>Most integrated gas players</strong> have experienced earnings pressure from the 2020 down cycle in gas prices. Because of this, they are becoming bigger, more diversified, and more dependent on third-party volumes. LNG producers are also developing greater flexibility and are investing in building stronger commercial capabilities, such as origination, trading, optimization, strategy, and marketing. Many aspire to capture incremental margins from global arbitrage opportunities and better manage the risks of market disruptions.</p>
<!-- -->
<p>This past year has been a perfect storm of market disruption brought on by supply overcapacity and reduced demand fueled by the COVID-19 pandemic’s effect on economic activity. To see how producers performed in this environment, we conducted two analyses to compare the performance of traditional integrated producers such as marketers with portfolio optimizers.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="80f17648-641c-4ffa-baf4-71b34e414e5d"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">1</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="80f17648-641c-4ffa-baf4-71b34e414e5d" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">A portfolio optimizer employs a portfolio optimization business model, which focuses on optimizing flows across the overall asset portfolio to capture the best opportunities and minimize transportation cost. Scale and optionality to manage both equity production and third-party volumes through advanced trading and optimization capabilities are also priorities.</span></span></span></a></span> Even though most producers have been severely affected by market disruption, our analyses revealed that portfolio optimizers generally outperform those with traditional business models during severe downturns.</p>
<p>While the analyses evaluate the performance of LNG producers specifically, the implications are relevant for all players across the LNG commercial­ization value chain that want to capture the full value of their portfolios and manage risk. Integrated LNG players that want to pursue a porfolio-optimization business model should focus their efforts in three areas: under­standing strengths and weaknesses in the current market, exploring moves to expand and strengthen the portfolio, and developing advanced LNG optimization and risk-management capabilities.</p>
<h2>Differences in performance: Marketers versus portfolio optimizers</h2>
<p>While the pandemic has affected economic activity, the LNG industry was already on the path to overcapacity. Compared with the start of 2019, for instance, there has been a 6 percent increase in active LNG liquefaction capacity; and with European gas demand down by 5 percent in the first half of 2020, regional prices dropped to record lows, converging to below $2 per one million British thermal units in June and July 2020 (Exhibit 1), though gas prices started improving in third quarter 2020.</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 1</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex1-newdata.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="In the first half of 2020, gas prices declined and converged across basins due to overcapacity and COVID-19." src="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex1-newdata.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<p>To see how LNG producers fare in this environment, we conducted two analyses: a financial reporting analysis and a bottom-up, outside-in modeling exer­cise. In both cases we compared the performance of two LNG producer archetypes: marketers and portfolio optimizers (Exhibit 2).</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 2</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex2.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="Portfolio optimizers and traditional point-to-point marketers are both producers across the value chain." src="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex2.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<p>Our findings in both instances indicate that producers that operate as portfolio optimizers achieved superior performance amid the recent market disruption when compared with marketers that used traditional point-to-point marketing models.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="f1a08cee-5da9-475b-ba5a-bcf0f49bab36"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">2</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="f1a08cee-5da9-475b-ba5a-bcf0f49bab36" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">A traditional point-to-point marketing model does not have significant flexibilities or third-party volumes, and contracts are also inflexible.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<h3>Financial reporting analysis</h3>
<p>Lack of transparency in reporting<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="3a283ba1-cdcf-4771-b95e-7685f2f8e84c"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">3</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="3a283ba1-cdcf-4771-b95e-7685f2f8e84c" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Companies often do not report earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization on integrated gas separately.</span></span></span></a></span> and the lag in impact on LNG long-term contract prices have made it harder to assess the true impact of recent events on marketers versus optimizers.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="1ce2654e-0bf9-41d1-9445-6dd812441a5a"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">4</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="1ce2654e-0bf9-41d1-9445-6dd812441a5a" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Price of oil-linked LNG contracts tend to lag behind the oil spot price by about three to six months.</span></span></span></a></span> We have, however, attempted to compare how the realized gas prices of three of the most advanced portfolio players developed against the realized prices of two typical upstream marketers.</p>
<p>The analysis indicates that in third quarter 2020, traditional marketers saw a 47 percent decline<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="6b425425-c7d3-4310-8c50-c4532757d69b"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">5</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="6b425425-c7d3-4310-8c50-c4532757d69b" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Weighted average based on the size of LNG production.</span></span></span></a></span> in realized prices compared with third quarter 2019, whereas the portfolio optimizers saw a 31 percent decline in realized prices over the same period (Exhibit 3). Although there are some obvious short­comings in this comparison—for example, the declines could be due to different geographic presences or a time lag on indexation—the findings do suggest that in the gas industry, portfolio opti­mizers were less affected by the recent downturn.</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 3</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex3.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="Portfolio optimizers have seen a slower decline in realized prices and volumes compared with marketers since third quarter 2019." src="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex3.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<h3>Bottom-up and outside-in modeling</h3>
<!-- -->
<p>To better understand how significantly operating models affect earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA), we modeled the performance of two LNG players with the same assets but different operating models.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="ea07bb60-8610-48fe-a7a0-ee8b6c6e3ba1"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">6</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="ea07bb60-8610-48fe-a7a0-ee8b6c6e3ba1" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">An advanced analytics model was used for this analysis; it models the optimal flows across LNG portfolios to maximize the risk-adjusted portfolio margin on top of the upstream margin. </span></span></span></a></span> Player A is an illustrative example of a marketer with a liquefaction portfolio that sells the volumes from each liquefaction position through a flexible, long-term contract that goes directly to a fixed set of buyers. Player B is a real-life portfolio optimizer with the same liquefaction assets, but with an additional portfolio of mostly free-on-board third-party offtake contracts,<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="a6a919e8-e035-455f-95bc-befe3d7a415c"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">7</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="a6a919e8-e035-455f-95bc-befe3d7a415c" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Free on board” refers to whether the buyer or the seller is responsible for a product while it is being shipped. A third-party offtake is an agreement in which the offtaker agrees to take a portion of supply from the buyer.</span></span></span></a></span> and access to LNG spot markets across the globe.</p>
<p>We typically use the optimization model to understand the value of portfolio optimization in future price scenarios, but in this case we used the actual prices over the past 18 months, taking into account a time lag on long-term contracts.</p>
<p>The findings show that both players have been severely hit—especially on upstream margins due to absolute-price decreases and on portfolio value—because of different prices narrowing. But because the value of Player B’s short-term optimization activities increased, its overall decline in EBITDA has been less severe compared with Player A (Exhibit 4).</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 4</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex4.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="The portfolio-optimization business model was more resilient in the recent down cycle." src="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex4.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<p> Player B’s short-term optimization activities included six tactics:</p>
<ul>
    <li><em>Practicing price arbitrage across regional gas markets,</em> such as between the United States (Henry Hub), Europe (TTF), and Asia and global LNG (JKM and oil-linked contracts), which underwent significant disruptions and moved out of sync</li>
    <li><em>Securing an integrated spread through the entire gas value chain;</em> for instance, monetizing price differentials between gas and electricity for European positions</li>
    <li><em>Practicing time arbitrage, </em>or using regasification storage—occasionally floating LNG storage—to its advantage in Europe when selling gas for more than the spot price</li>
    <li><em>Pursuing volume flexibilities</em> by reallocating cargoes from spot-lifting regions (such as the United States and Australia) to some higher-priced, oil-linked sale and purchase agreements (SPAs), and exercising downward volume-flexibility options and carry-forward options<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="8117d4fd-ce37-4232-8be8-20fb9396d20d"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">8</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="8117d4fd-ce37-4232-8be8-20fb9396d20d" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Carry-forward options refer to stipulations within a contract in which a buyer can take more than the amount specified and rebalance it against quantities in coming years.</span></span></span></a></span> across the entire SPA portfolio</li>
    <li><em>Optimizing shipping</em> through time-charter positions—that is, reallocating charters between routes and revising strategies for where to reposition ships after spot commitments are met</li>
    <li><em>Finding market opportunities for other market players</em> by extracting value from medium-term commitment options by, for instance, offering call options (for two to five years) on cargoes going to clients that paid a premium, given the uncertainty of future LNG spot-price curves</li>
</ul>
<p>Portfolio optimizers can monetize these opportunities because they have flexible portfolios and advanced commercial capabilities with superior logistics and access to liquidity—through regasification and direct relationships with buyers—across basins.</p>
<p>To illustrate the differences between business models in practice, we analyzed the actual LNG flows from two liquefaction assets: one owned by players with a more traditional marketing model and one owned by players that employ a portfolio-optimization model.</p>
<div data-module-category="" class="PullQuote_mck-c-pullquote__DbaQ5 mck-o-lg-center" style="transform: translate(0px, 35px); opacity: 0;"><blockquote data-component="mdc-c-blockquote" class="PullQuote_mck-c-blockquote__6n21p PullQuote_mck-c-blockquote--hide-quotes__CpGpg mdc-c-blockquote mdc-c-blockquote--is-quotes___TozKo_990311c"><p>Portfolio optimizers can monetize these opportunities because they have flexible portfolios and advanced commercial capabilities with superior logistics and access to liquidity across basins.</p></blockquote></div>
<p>We tracked flows from both players’ liquefaction plants and found that the portfolio optimizer shipped to 31 separate markets in 2019, whereas the marketer served only five markets (Exhibit 5). Flows from the optimizer also changed cargo destinations much more often; of the 23 markets served across either second quarter 2019 or second quarter 2020, 12 markets were not served in both years. For the traditional marketer, 40 percent of their markets were served during both years. These findings clearly indicate that the portfolio optimizers use their assets to capture opportunities across a wide variety of markets and can monetize their optionality, whereas the marketers supplied a steady flow into a few end markets.</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-inline-module-container mck-o-md-center"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-lg mdc-u-grid-col-sm-1 mdc-u-grid--align-start mdc-u-mb-3 GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__sGwKL"><div data-component="mdc-c-content-block" class="mdc-c-content-block___7p6Lu_990311c mdc-u-grid-gutter-xs GenericItem_mck-c-generic-item__content__gq1m0"><div class="mck-c-eyebrow mdc-u-ts-10"><span>Exhibit 5</span></div></div></div><div class="mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom"><picture data-component="mdc-c-picture" class="Exhibit_mck-c-exhibit__image__pyIDm"><source media="(min-width: 768px)" srcset="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex5.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center"><img alt="Portfolio optimizers continuously optimize their flows for improved results." src="/~/media/mckinsey/industries/oil%20and%20gas/our%20insights/lng%20portfolio%20optimization%20putting%20the%20business%20model%20to%20the%20test/svg-lng-portfoliooptimization-ex5.svgz?cq=50&cpy=Center" loading="lazy"></picture></div><div class="mck-u-sr-only">We strive to provide individuals with disabilities equal access to our website. If you would like information about this content we will be happy to work with you. Please email us at: <a href="mailto:McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com">McKinsey_Website_Accessibility@mckinsey.com</a></div></div>
<h2>Business-model transformation</h2>
<p>LNG players that want to adopt a portfolio-optimization business model should focus their efforts in three areas.</p>
<h3>Understand the strengths and weaknesses of the current portfolio</h3>
<p>Traditional players should first survey their current portfolio positioning and capabilities to see whether optimization is the right strategic option for them.</p>
<p><em>Does the portfolio have sufficient scale? </em>Smaller, concentrated portfolios (less than five million tons per annum) often have less optimization value and do not warrant setting up optimization capabilities.</p>
<p><em>Is the portfolio missing key assets? </em>Portfolio optimization is enhanced through the combination of equity and third-party offtake volumes, access to spot LNG markets, regasification capacity and hub access, and positions in multiple basins. Producers should review their current portfolio against these assets to see where gaps exist.</p>
<div data-component="mdc-c-module-wrapper" data-module-theme="default" data-module-background="transparent" data-module-category="" class="mck-c-disruptor1up mck-o-md-center mck-u-inline-module-border-top mck-u-inline-module-border-bottom mck-u-screen-only" data-layer-region="disruptor-1up"><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-md mdc-u-grid-col-lg-12 mdc-u-grid-col-md-12 "><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-md-span-12"><header data-component="mdc-c-header" class="mdc-c-header"><div class="mdc-c-header__block___i1Lg-_990311c"><h3 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c"><div>Would you like to learn more about our <a href="/industries/oil-and-gas/how-we-help-clients">Oil & Gas Practice</a>?</div></h3></div></header><div data-component="mdc-c-link-container" class="mdc-c-link-container___xefGu_990311c mdc-c-link-container--display-column___X0HDD_990311c mck-c-disruptor1up__content Disruptor1Up_mck-c-disruptor1up__content--links__VV4lE mdc-u-grid-gutter-md"><a data-component="mdc-c-link" href="/industries/oil-and-gas/how-we-help-clients/global-gas" class="mdc-c-link-cta___NBQVi_990311c"><span class="mdc-c-link__label___Pfqtd_990311c">Visit our Global Gas page</span><span data-component="mdc-c-icon" class="mdc-c-icon___oi7ef_990311c mck-link-arrow-right-icon"></span></a></div></div></div></div>
<p><em>What is the current portfolio risk?</em> Some portfolios respond differently to changes in commodity prices, increased volatility, or the drying up of spot markets due to differences in spot versus long-term contracted volumes, long-term contract price indexations, contract volume flexibilities (obtained or committed), or market access (direct hub access, paper trading capabilities). LNG players need a clear understanding of what can happen to the profitability of their portfolios in different market scenarios.</p>
<h3>Explore moves to expand and strengthen the portfolio</h3>
<p>Once LNG players have assessed their starting point, they should make strategic decisions to optimize their portfolio. Most leading players focus their efforts on M&A, third-party assets, and alliance building.</p>
<p><em>What M&A options could help build the portfolio?</em> Many leading portfolio players have actively expanded their LNG portfolios through acquisitions. For example, Shell acquired Repsol’s LNG assets in 2014<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="4e208bbc-857a-48af-8ba8-90ed347f81df"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">9</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="4e208bbc-857a-48af-8ba8-90ed347f81df" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Shell boosts its leadership in global LNG with the completion of Repsol S.A. LNG deal,” Shell, January 2, 2014, shell.com.</span></span></span></a></span> and BG’s in 2016,<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="b1fb326b-0c86-443c-ba71-fdc17d9133fc"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">10</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="b1fb326b-0c86-443c-ba71-fdc17d9133fc" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Ron Bousso, “BG shareholders give Shell's $52 billion acquisition final nod,” Reuters, January 28, 2016, reuters.com.</span></span></span></a></span> building the largest LNG portfolio of all majors and further solidifying its presence in Africa. Pavilion acquired Iberdrola’s LNG assets in 2019 to expand into Europe and the Atlantic basin.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="ab81bfbb-2632-400c-84f1-56627c6327d8"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">11</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="ab81bfbb-2632-400c-84f1-56627c6327d8" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Jessica Jaganathan, “Singapore's Pavilion Energy to acquire LNG assets of Spain's Iberdrola,” Reuters, June 19, 2019, reuters.com.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<p>Triggered by capital constraints, the industry is also starting to focus more on merger opportunities where players can consolidate their portfolios into a dedicated vehicle and free up capital for parent companies.</p>
<p><em>How can the organization access third-party assets to extract additional value?</em> The large international oil companies and trading houses have been building their portfolios through third-party offtake agreements—for instance, independent producers in the United States providing flexible volumes at a Henry Hub price indexation.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="22e9bd53-ee15-4771-aeb8-a02d92053ab8"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">12</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="22e9bd53-ee15-4771-aeb8-a02d92053ab8" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">McKinsey LNG contract database.</span></span></span></a></span> Further downstream, players are obtaining access to third-party asset capacity. Examples include Uniper’s deal with Pavilion,<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="2a84c6b2-84ce-45bc-bea3-a8bf3c769d38"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">13</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="2a84c6b2-84ce-45bc-bea3-a8bf3c769d38" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">Georg Oppermann, “Uniper and Singapore’s Pavilion Gas sign LNG deal providing access to their assets in respective home markets,” Uniper, September 20, 2017, uniper.energy.</span></span></span></a></span> which provides access to each other’s LNG assets, or several producers booking regasification capacity in Europe.</p>
<p><em>How can the organization form alliances and joint ventures to capture synergies with other LNG portfolios?</em> Instead of investing large amounts of capital in resources or midstream assets, portfolio-optimization benefits can be obtained
by partnering with other players, as seen in the partnerships between Commonwealth LNG and Gunvor in the United States<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="c432c50c-f1c7-4a9f-a10e-26c4bd9a1154"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">14</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="c432c50c-f1c7-4a9f-a10e-26c4bd9a1154" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Gunvor enters into strategic LNG marketing & gas supply agreement with Commonwealth LNG,” November 25, 2019, gunvorgroup.com.</span></span></span></a></span> or ENH and Vitol in Mozambique.<span class="FootNote_footnote-holder__tjRqy"><a aria-label="footnote" href="javascript:void(0);" class="FootNote_footnote-wrapper__AIRwL undefined FootNote_inactive__VZfCp" aria-describedby="f506cbfd-5349-4951-a526-c4fcd878abf8"><sup class="FootNote_footnotesup__e73z_">15</sup><span class="FootNote_notch-wrapper__b_5NS"><span class="FootNote_notch__omKtY"></span></span><span class="FootNote_tooltip__QtrbA mdc-u-mt-2"><span class="FootNote_footnote-content__r2OVl"><span id="f506cbfd-5349-4951-a526-c4fcd878abf8" aria-hidden="true" data-module-theme="light" class="FootNote_footnote-text__VjKgO mck-u-links-inline">“Vitol and ENH announce the launch of ENH Energy Trading,” September 17, 2019, vitol.com.</span></span></span></a></span></p>
<h3>Develop advanced LNG portfolio-optimization and risk-management capabilities</h3>
<p>If LNG players want to play the game and do it well, they will need the right talent and technologies in place.</p>
<p><em>What new talent can enable portfolio optimization?</em> Responsibly capturing the full value from a portfolio requires building <a href="/industries/oil-and-gas/our-insights/winning-the-race-for-world-class-lng-optimization-capabilities">more advanced trading, optimi­zation, and risk-management capabilities</a> that can support the business model shift. To do so, players will need people with the right mix of skills to help transform organizational capabilities.</p>
<p><em>How can new technologies and tools support portfolio optimization?</em> Portfolio optimization can be challenging; strong advanced analytics capabilities are essential to support day-to-day decision making. Using nontraditional data sources, such as vessel tracking or satellite imagery, and advanced-analytics technologies, such as machine learning, can support even better optimization decisions. For instance, LNG portfolio players can use these tools to make scheduling and dispatching decisions to capture time-arbitrage opportunities or strategically redirect cargoes to monetize geographic-arbitrage opportunities, further enhancing optimization value.</p>
<hr>
<p>Portfolio optimization will be critical to LNG players that want to navigate current and future market disruptions. Indeed, those that invest in optimization capabilities and larger, more flexible portfolios will be better able to adjust to changing market dynamics, explore more market opportunities, and achieve long-term resilience. From a broader perspective, portfolio optimizers can also have a positive impact on the energy market by reducing inefficiencies and making the overall system more resistant to shocks, leading to more affordable, uninterrupted energy available to communities around the world. For example, portfolio players served an important role in redirecting volumes originally destined for China to Europe, and vice versa, during the pandemic. Whatever the future holds, portfolio optimization can help LNG players improve their risk-management capabilities and remain flexible.</p></div><div class="container-placeholder"></div></div></div><div class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-gutter-xl"><section role="contentinfo" data-layer-region="article-about-authors" class="mdc-u-grid mdc-u-grid-col-md-12 AboutAuthor_mck-c-about-author__nRJzu"><div class="mdc-u-grid-col-md-start-2 mdc-u-grid-col-md-end-12 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-start-3 mdc-u-grid-col-lg-end-11"><h5 data-component="mdc-c-heading" class="mdc-c-heading___0fM1W_990311c mdc-c-heading--title___5qyOB_990311c mdc-c-heading--border___K8dj3_990311c mdc-u-align-center">About the author(s)</h5><div data-component="mdc-c-description" class="mdc-c-description___SrnQP_990311c mdc-u-ts-8 mck-u-links-inline mck-u-links-inline--secondary mdc-u-mt-5"><div><p><strong><a href="/our-people/alessandro-agosta">Alessandro Agosta</a></strong> is a partner in McKinsey’s Milan office, <strong><a href="/our-people/dumitru-dediu">Dumitru Dediu</a></strong> is a partner in the Boston office, and <strong>Timo Leenman</strong> is a specialist in the Amsterdam office, where <strong>Marijn van Diessen</strong> is an associate partner. </p>

Because of this, they are becoming bigger, more diversified, and more dependent on third-party volumes. LNG producers are also developing greater flexibility and are investing in building stronger commercial capabilities, such as origination, trading, optimization, strategy, and marketing. Many aspire to capture incremental margins from global arbitrage opportunities and better manage the risks of market disruptions.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[AUDIO 1]]\n\u003cp\u003eThis past year has been a perfect storm of market disruption brought on by supply overcapacity and reduced demand fueled by the COVID-19 pandemic\u0026rsquo;s effect on economic activity. To see how producers performed in this environment, we conducted two analyses to compare the performance of traditional integrated producers such as marketers with portfolio optimizers.[[Footnote 1]] Even though most producers have been severely affected by market disruption, our analyses revealed that portfolio optimizers generally outperform those with traditional business models during severe downturns.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the analyses evaluate the performance of LNG producers specifically, the implications are relevant for all players across the LNG commercial­ization value chain that want to capture the full value of their portfolios and manage risk. Integrated LNG players that want to pursue a porfolio-optimization business model should focus their efforts in three areas: under­standing strengths and weaknesses in the current market, exploring moves to expand and strengthen the portfolio, and developing advanced LNG optimization and risk-management capabilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eDifferences in performance: Marketers versus portfolio optimizers\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the pandemic has affected economic activity, the LNG industry was already on the path to overcapacity. Compared with the start of 2019, for instance, there has been a 6 percent increase in active LNG liquefaction capacity; and with European gas demand down by 5 percent in the first half of 2020, regional prices dropped to record lows, converging to below $2 per one million British thermal units in June and July 2020 (Exhibit 1), though gas prices started improving in third quarter 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Exhibit 1]]\n\u003cp\u003eTo see how LNG producers fare in this environment, we conducted two analyses: a financial reporting analysis and a bottom-up, outside-in modeling exer­cise. In both cases we compared the performance of two LNG producer archetypes: marketers and portfolio optimizers (Exhibit 2).\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Exhibit 2]]\n\u003cp\u003eOur findings in both instances indicate that producers that operate as portfolio optimizers achieved superior performance amid the recent market disruption when compared with marketers that used traditional point-to-point marketing models.[[Footnote 2]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eFinancial reporting analysis\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLack of transparency in reporting[[Footnote 3]] and the lag in impact on LNG long-term contract prices have made it harder to assess the true impact of recent events on marketers versus optimizers.[[Footnote 4]] We have, however, attempted to compare how the realized gas prices of three of the most advanced portfolio players developed against the realized prices of two typical upstream marketers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe analysis indicates that in third quarter 2020, traditional marketers saw a 47 percent decline[[Footnote 5]] in realized prices compared with third quarter 2019, whereas the portfolio optimizers saw a 31 percent decline in realized prices over the same period (Exhibit 3). Although there are some obvious short­comings in this comparison\u0026mdash;for example, the declines could be due to different geographic presences or a time lag on indexation\u0026mdash;the findings do suggest that in the gas industry, portfolio opti­mizers were less affected by the recent downturn.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Exhibit 3]]\n\u003ch3\u003eBottom-up and outside-in modeling\u003c/h3\u003e\n[[MostPopularArticles 5]]\n\u003cp\u003eTo better understand how significantly operating models affect earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA), we modeled the performance of two LNG players with the same assets but different operating models.[[Footnote 6]] Player A is an illustrative example of a marketer with a liquefaction portfolio that sells the volumes from each liquefaction position through a flexible, long-term contract that goes directly to a fixed set of buyers. Player B is a real-life portfolio optimizer with the same liquefaction assets, but with an additional portfolio of mostly free-on-board third-party offtake contracts,[[Footnote 7]] and access to LNG spot markets across the globe.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe typically use the optimization model to understand the value of portfolio optimization in future price scenarios, but in this case we used the actual prices over the past 18 months, taking into account a time lag on long-term contracts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe findings show that both players have been severely hit\u0026mdash;especially on upstream margins due to absolute-price decreases and on portfolio value\u0026mdash;because of different prices narrowing. But because the value of Player B\u0026rsquo;s short-term optimization activities increased, its overall decline in EBITDA has been less severe compared with Player A (Exhibit 4).\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Exhibit 4]]\n\u003cp\u003e Player B\u0026rsquo;s short-term optimization activities included six tactics:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003ePracticing price arbitrage across regional gas markets,\u003c/em\u003e such as between the United States (Henry Hub), Europe (TTF), and Asia and global LNG (JKM and oil-linked contracts), which underwent significant disruptions and moved out of sync\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eSecuring an integrated spread through the entire gas value chain;\u003c/em\u003e for instance, monetizing price differentials between gas and electricity for European positions\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003ePracticing time arbitrage, \u003c/em\u003eor using regasification storage\u0026mdash;occasionally floating LNG storage\u0026mdash;to its advantage in Europe when selling gas for more than the spot price\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003ePursuing volume flexibilities\u003c/em\u003e by reallocating cargoes from spot-lifting regions (such as the United States and Australia) to some higher-priced, oil-linked sale and purchase agreements (SPAs), and exercising downward volume-flexibility options and carry-forward options[[Footnote 8]] across the entire SPA portfolio\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eOptimizing shipping\u003c/em\u003e through time-charter positions\u0026mdash;that is, reallocating charters between routes and revising strategies for where to reposition ships after spot commitments are met\u003c/li\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eFinding market opportunities for other market players\u003c/em\u003e by extracting value from medium-term commitment options by, for instance, offering call options (for two to five years) on cargoes going to clients that paid a premium, given the uncertainty of future LNG spot-price curves\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePortfolio optimizers can monetize these opportunities because they have flexible portfolios and advanced commercial capabilities with superior logistics and access to liquidity\u0026mdash;through regasification and direct relationships with buyers\u0026mdash;across basins.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTo illustrate the differences between business models in practice, we analyzed the actual LNG flows from two liquefaction assets: one owned by players with a more traditional marketing model and one owned by players that employ a portfolio-optimization model.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Pullquote 1]]\n\u003cp\u003eWe tracked flows from both players\u0026rsquo; liquefaction plants and found that the portfolio optimizer shipped to 31 separate markets in 2019, whereas the marketer served only five markets (Exhibit 5). Flows from the optimizer also changed cargo destinations much more often; of the 23 markets served across either second quarter 2019 or second quarter 2020, 12 markets were not served in both years. For the traditional marketer, 40 percent of their markets were served during both years. These findings clearly indicate that the portfolio optimizers use their assets to capture opportunities across a wide variety of markets and can monetize their optionality, whereas the marketers supplied a steady flow into a few end markets.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Exhibit 5]]\n\u003ch2\u003eBusiness-model transformation\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eLNG players that want to adopt a portfolio-optimization business model should focus their efforts in three areas.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eUnderstand the strengths and weaknesses of the current portfolio\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTraditional players should first survey their current portfolio positioning and capabilities to see whether optimization is the right strategic option for them.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eDoes the portfolio have sufficient scale? \u003c/em\u003eSmaller, concentrated portfolios (less than five million tons per annum) often have less optimization value and do not warrant setting up optimization capabilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eIs the portfolio missing key assets? \u003c/em\u003ePortfolio optimization is enhanced through the combination of equity and third-party offtake volumes, access to spot LNG markets, regasification capacity and hub access, and positions in multiple basins. Producers should review their current portfolio against these assets to see where gaps exist.\u003c/p\u003e\n[[Disruptor1UP dis1]]\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhat is the current portfolio risk?\u003c/em\u003e Some portfolios respond differently to changes in commodity prices, increased volatility, or the drying up of spot markets due to differences in spot versus long-term contracted volumes, long-term contract price indexations, contract volume flexibilities (obtained or committed), or market access (direct hub access, paper trading capabilities). LNG players need a clear understanding of what can happen to the profitability of their portfolios in different market scenarios.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eExplore moves to expand and strengthen the portfolio\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eOnce LNG players have assessed their starting point, they should make strategic decisions to optimize their portfolio. Most leading players focus their efforts on M\u0026amp;A, third-party assets, and alliance building.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhat M\u0026amp;A options could help build the portfolio?\u003c/em\u003e Many leading portfolio players have actively expanded their LNG portfolios through acquisitions. For example, Shell acquired Repsol\u0026rsquo;s LNG assets in 2014[[Footnote 9]] and BG\u0026rsquo;s in 2016,[[Footnote 10]] building the largest LNG portfolio of all majors and further solidifying its presence in Africa. Pavilion acquired Iberdrola\u0026rsquo;s LNG assets in 2019 to expand into Europe and the Atlantic basin.[[Footnote 11]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eTriggered by capital constraints, the industry is also starting to focus more on merger opportunities where players can consolidate their portfolios into a dedicated vehicle and free up capital for parent companies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow can the organization access third-party assets to extract additional value?\u003c/em\u003e The large international oil companies and trading houses have been building their portfolios through third-party offtake agreements\u0026mdash;for instance, independent producers in the United States providing flexible volumes at a Henry Hub price indexation.[[Footnote 12]] Further downstream, players are obtaining access to third-party asset capacity. Examples include Uniper\u0026rsquo;s deal with Pavilion,[[Footnote 13]] which provides access to each other\u0026rsquo;s LNG assets, or several producers booking regasification capacity in Europe.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow can the organization form alliances and joint ventures to capture synergies with other LNG portfolios?\u003c/em\u003e Instead of investing large amounts of capital in resources or midstream assets, portfolio-optimization benefits can be obtained\nby partnering with other players, as seen in the partnerships between Commonwealth LNG and Gunvor in the United States[[Footnote 14]] or ENH and Vitol in Mozambique.[[Footnote 15]]\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eDevelop advanced LNG portfolio-optimization and risk-management capabilities\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf LNG players want to play the game and do it well, they will need the right talent and technologies in place.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eWhat new talent can enable portfolio optimization?\u003c/em\u003e Responsibly capturing the full value from a portfolio requires building \u003ca href=\"/industries/oil-and-gas/our-insights/winning-the-race-for-world-class-lng-optimization-capabilities\"\u003emore advanced trading, optimi­zation, and risk-management capabilities\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;that can support the business model shift. To do so, players will need people with the right mix of skills to help transform organizational capabilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eHow can new technologies and tools support portfolio optimization?\u003c/em\u003e Portfolio optimization can be challenging; strong advanced analytics capabilities are essential to support day-to-day decision making. Using nontraditional data sources, such as vessel tracking or satellite imagery, and advanced-analytics technologies, such as machine learning, can support even better optimization decisions. For instance, LNG portfolio players can use these tools to make scheduling and dispatching decisions to capture time-arbitrage opportunities or strategically redirect cargoes to monetize geographic-arbitrage opportunities, further enhancing optimization value.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003chr /\u003e\n\u003cp\u003ePortfolio optimization will be critical to LNG players that want to navigate current and future market disruptions. Indeed, those that invest in optimization capabilities and larger, more flexible portfolios will be better able to adjust to changing market dynamics, explore more market opportunities, and achieve long-term resilience. From a broader perspective, portfolio optimizers can also have a positive impact on the energy market by reducing inefficiencies and making the overall system more resistant to shocks, leading to more affordable, uninterrupted energy available to communities around the world. For example, portfolio players served an important role in redirecting volumes originally destined for China to Europe, and vice versa, during the pandemic. Whatever the future holds, portfolio optimization can help LNG players improve their risk-management capabilities and remain flexible.\u003c/p\u003e"},"isFullScreenInteractive":{"boolValue":false},"hideStickySocialShareBar":{"boolValue":false},"desktopID":{"value":""},"mobileID":{"value":""},"desktopURL":{"value":""},"mobileURL":{"value":""},"desktopPaddingPercentage":{"value":""},"mobilePaddingPercentage":{"value":""},"desktopOverrideHeight":{"value":""},"mobileOverrideHeight":{"value":""},"cerosOembedURL":{"value":""},"cerosRenderMode":{"targetItem":null},"cerosBackgroundColor":{"targetItem":null},"hideByLine":{"boolValue":false},"tableOfContentsTitle":{"value":"TABLE OF CONTENTS"},"accessStatus":{"targetItem":{"key":{"value":"RegisteredUsers"},"value":{"value":"Registered Users"}}},"articleType":{"targetItem":{"displayName":"Article"}},"hasSpecialReport":{"boolValue":false},"contentType":{"targetItem":{"displayName":"Article"}},"sourcePublication":{"targetItem":null},"externalPublication":{"value":""},"mobileReady":{"boolValue":true},"forClientsOnly":{"boolValue":false},"excludeFromClientLink":{"boolValue":false},"originalPublishDate":{"jsonValue":{"value":"2021-04-12T00:00:00Z"}},"footnotes":{"value":"\u003col\u003e\n    \u003cli\u003eA portfolio optimizer employs a portfolio optimization business model, which focuses on optimizing flows across the overall asset portfolio to capture the best opportunities and minimize transportation cost.
